111 /** Id for identifying Table SDIs */

114 /** Id for identifying Tablespace SDIs */

117 /** Key to identify a dictionary object */
118 struct sdi_key_t {
119  /** Type of Object, For ex: column, index, etc */
120  uint32 type;
121 
122  /** Object id which should be unique in tablespsace */
123  uint64 id;
124 };
125 
126 using sdi_container = std::vector<sdi_key_t>;
127 struct sdi_vector_t {
128  sdi_container m_vec;
129 };

132  uint key_length, ulonglong *engine_data);

148 /// Maps from slot to plugin. May return NULL if plugin has been unloaded.
149 st_plugin_int *hton2plugin(uint slot);
150 /// Returns the size of the array holding pointers to plugins.
151 size_t num_hton2plugins();
152 
153 /**
154  For unit testing.
155  Insert plugin into arbitrary slot in array.
156  Remove plugin from arbitrary slot in array.
157 */
158 st_plugin_int *insert_hton2plugin(uint slot, st_plugin_int *plugin);
159 st_plugin_int *remove_hton2plugin(uint slot);

167 // the following is for checking tables
168 
169 #define HA_ADMIN_ALREADY_DONE 1
170 #define HA_ADMIN_OK 0
171 #define HA_ADMIN_NOT_IMPLEMENTED -1
172 #define HA_ADMIN_FAILED -2
173 #define HA_ADMIN_CORRUPT -3
174 #define HA_ADMIN_INTERNAL_ERROR -4
175 #define HA_ADMIN_INVALID -5
176 #define HA_ADMIN_REJECT -6
177 #define HA_ADMIN_TRY_ALTER -7
178 #define HA_ADMIN_WRONG_CHECKSUM -8
179 #define HA_ADMIN_NOT_BASE_TABLE -9
180 #define HA_ADMIN_NEEDS_UPGRADE -10
181 #define HA_ADMIN_NEEDS_ALTER -11
182 #define HA_ADMIN_NEEDS_CHECK -12
183 #define HA_ADMIN_STATS_UPD_ERR -13
184 /** User needs to dump and re-create table to fix pre 5.0 decimal types */
185 #define HA_ADMIN_NEEDS_DUMP_UPGRADE -14
186 
187 /**
188  Return values for check_if_supported_inplace_alter().
189 
190  @see check_if_supported_inplace_alter() for description of
191  the individual values.
192 */
193 enum enum_alter_inplace_result {
194  HA_ALTER_ERROR,
195  HA_ALTER_INPLACE_NOT_SUPPORTED,
196  HA_ALTER_INPLACE_EXCLUSIVE_LOCK,
197  HA_ALTER_INPLACE_SHARED_LOCK_AFTER_PREPARE,
198  HA_ALTER_INPLACE_SHARED_LOCK,
199  HA_ALTER_INPLACE_NO_LOCK_AFTER_PREPARE,
200  HA_ALTER_INPLACE_NO_LOCK,
201  HA_ALTER_INPLACE_INSTANT
202 };
203 
204 /* Bits in table_flags() to show what database can do */
205 
206 #define HA_NO_TRANSACTIONS (1 << 0) /* Doesn't support transactions */
207 #define HA_PARTIAL_COLUMN_READ (1 << 1) /* read may not return all columns */
208 /*
209  Used to avoid scanning full tables on an index. If this flag is set then
210  the handler always has a primary key (hidden if not defined) and this
211  index is used for scanning rather than a full table scan in all
212  situations. No separate data/index file.
213 */
214 #define HA_TABLE_SCAN_ON_INDEX (1 << 2)
215 
216 /// Not in use.
217 #define HA_UNUSED3 (1 << 3)
218 
219 /*
220  Can the storage engine handle spatial data.
221  Used to check that no spatial attributes are declared unless
222  the storage engine is capable of handling it.
223 */
224 #define HA_CAN_GEOMETRY (1 << 4)
225 /*
226  Reading keys in random order is as fast as reading keys in sort order
227  (Used by filesort to decide if we should sort key + data or key +
228  pointer-to-row.)
229 */
230 #define HA_FAST_KEY_READ (1 << 5)
231 /*
232  Set the following flag if we on delete should force all key to be read
233  and on update read all keys that changes
234 */
235 #define HA_REQUIRES_KEY_COLUMNS_FOR_DELETE (1 << 6)
236 /*
237  Is NULL values allowed in indexes.
238  If this is not allowed then it is not possible to use an index on a
239  NULLable field.
240 */
241 #define HA_NULL_IN_KEY (1 << 7)
242 /*
243  Tells that we can the position for the conflicting duplicate key
244  record is stored in table->file->dupp_ref. (insert uses rnd_pos() on
245  this to find the duplicated row)
246 */
247 #define HA_DUPLICATE_POS (1 << 8)
248 #define HA_NO_BLOBS (1 << 9) /* Doesn't support blobs */
249 /*
250  Is the storage engine capable of defining an index of a prefix on
251  a BLOB attribute.
252 */
253 #define HA_CAN_INDEX_BLOBS (1 << 10)
254 /*
255  Auto increment fields can be part of a multi-part key. For second part
256  auto-increment keys, the auto_incrementing is done in handler.cc
257 */
258 #define HA_AUTO_PART_KEY (1 << 11)
259 /*
260  Can't define a table without primary key (and cannot handle a table
261  with hidden primary key)
262 */
263 #define HA_REQUIRE_PRIMARY_KEY (1 << 12)
264 /*
265  Does the counter of records after the info call specify an exact
266  value or not. If it does this flag is set.
267 */
268 #define HA_STATS_RECORDS_IS_EXACT (1 << 13)
269 /// Not in use.
270 #define HA_UNUSED14 (1 << 14)
271 /*
272  This parameter is set when the handler will also return the primary key
273  when doing read-only-key on another index, i.e., if we get the primary
274  key columns for free when we do an index read (usually, it also implies
275  that HA_PRIMARY_KEY_REQUIRED_FOR_POSITION flag is set).
276 */
277 #define HA_PRIMARY_KEY_IN_READ_INDEX (1 << 15)
278 /*
279  If HA_PRIMARY_KEY_REQUIRED_FOR_POSITION is set, it means that to position()
280  uses a primary key given by the record argument.
281  Without primary key, we can't call position().
282  If not set, the position is returned as the current rows position
283  regardless of what argument is given.
284 */
285 #define HA_PRIMARY_KEY_REQUIRED_FOR_POSITION (1 << 16)
286 #define HA_CAN_RTREEKEYS (1 << 17)
287 /// Not in use.
288 #define HA_UNUSED18
289 /*
290  The following is we need to a primary key to delete (and update) a row.
291  If there is no primary key, all columns needs to be read on update and delete
292 */
293 #define HA_PRIMARY_KEY_REQUIRED_FOR_DELETE (1 << 19)
294 /*
295  Indexes on prefixes of character fields are not allowed.
296 */
297 #define HA_NO_PREFIX_CHAR_KEYS (1 << 20)
298 /*
299  Does the storage engine support fulltext indexes.
300 */
301 #define HA_CAN_FULLTEXT (1 << 21)
302 /*
303  Can the HANDLER interface in the MySQL API be used towards this
304  storage engine.
305 */
306 #define HA_CAN_SQL_HANDLER (1 << 22)
307 /*
308  Set if the storage engine does not support auto increment fields.
309 */
310 #define HA_NO_AUTO_INCREMENT (1 << 23)
311 /*
312  Supports CHECKSUM option in CREATE TABLE (MyISAM feature).
313 */
314 #define HA_HAS_CHECKSUM (1 << 24)
315 /*
316  Table data are stored in separate files (for lower_case_table_names).
317  Should file names always be in lower case (used by engines that map
318  table names to file names.
319 */
320 #define HA_FILE_BASED (1 << 26)
321 #define HA_NO_VARCHAR (1 << 27)
322 /*
323  Is the storage engine capable of handling bit fields.
324 */
325 #define HA_CAN_BIT_FIELD (1 << 28)
326 #define HA_ANY_INDEX_MAY_BE_UNIQUE (1 << 30)
327 #define HA_NO_COPY_ON_ALTER (1LL << 31)
328 #define HA_COUNT_ROWS_INSTANT (1LL << 32) /* records() gives exact count*/
329 /* Has it's own method of binlog logging */
330 #define HA_HAS_OWN_BINLOGGING (1LL << 33)
331 /*
332  Engine is capable of row-format and statement-format logging,
333  respectively
334 */
335 #define HA_BINLOG_ROW_CAPABLE (1LL << 34)
336 #define HA_BINLOG_STMT_CAPABLE (1LL << 35)
337 /*
338  When a multiple key conflict happens in a REPLACE command mysql
339  expects the conflicts to be reported in the ascending order of
340  key names.
341 
342  For e.g.
343 
344  CREATE TABLE t1 (a INT, UNIQUE (a), b INT NOT NULL, UNIQUE (b), c INT NOT
345  NULL, INDEX(c));
346 
347  REPLACE INTO t1 VALUES (1,1,1),(2,2,2),(2,1,3);
348 
349  MySQL expects the conflict with 'a' to be reported before the conflict with
350  'b'.
351 
352  If the underlying storage engine does not report the conflicting keys in
353  ascending order, it causes unexpected errors when the REPLACE command is
354  executed.
355 
356  This flag helps the underlying SE to inform the server that the keys are not
357  ordered.
358 */
359 #define HA_DUPLICATE_KEY_NOT_IN_ORDER (1LL << 36)
360 /*
361  Engine supports REPAIR TABLE. Used by CHECK TABLE FOR UPGRADE if an
362  incompatible table is detected. If this flag is set, CHECK TABLE FOR UPGRADE
363  will report ER_TABLE_NEEDS_UPGRADE, otherwise ER_TABLE_NEED_REBUILD.
364 */
365 #define HA_CAN_REPAIR (1LL << 37)
366 
367 /*
368  Set of all binlog flags. Currently only contain the capabilities
369  flags.
370  */
371 #define HA_BINLOG_FLAGS (HA_BINLOG_ROW_CAPABLE | HA_BINLOG_STMT_CAPABLE)
372 
373 /**
374  The handler supports read before write removal optimization
375 
376  Read before write removal may be used for storage engines which support
377  write without previous read of the row to be updated. Handler returning
378  this flag must implement start_read_removal() and end_read_removal().
379  The handler may return "fake" rows constructed from the key of the row
380  asked for. This is used to optimize UPDATE and DELETE by reducing the
381  number of round-trips between handler and storage engine.
382 
383  Example:
384  UPDATE a=1 WHERE pk IN (@<keys@>)
385 
386  @verbatim
387  mysql_update()
388  {
389  if (<conditions for starting read removal>)
390  start_read_removal()
391  -> handler returns true if read removal supported for this table/query
392 
393  while(read_record("pk=<key>"))
394  -> handler returns fake row with column "pk" set to <key>
395 
396  ha_update_row()
397  -> handler sends write "a=1" for row with "pk=<key>"
398 
399  end_read_removal()
400  -> handler returns the number of rows actually written
401  }
402  @endverbatim
403 
404  @note This optimization in combination with batching may be used to
405  remove even more round-trips.
406 */
407 #define HA_READ_BEFORE_WRITE_REMOVAL (1LL << 38)
408 
409 /*
410  Engine supports extended fulltext API
411  */
412 #define HA_CAN_FULLTEXT_EXT (1LL << 39)
413 
414 /*
415  Storage engine doesn't synchronize result set with expected table contents.
416  Used by replication slave to check if it is possible to retrieve rows from
417  the table when deciding whether to do a full table scan, index scan or hash
418  scan while applying a row event.
419  */
420 #define HA_READ_OUT_OF_SYNC (1LL << 40)
421 
422 /*
423  Storage engine supports table export using the
424  FLUSH TABLE <table_list> FOR EXPORT statement.
425  */
426 #define HA_CAN_EXPORT (1LL << 41)
427 
428 /*
429  The handler don't want accesses to this table to
430  be const-table optimized
431 */
432 #define HA_BLOCK_CONST_TABLE (1LL << 42)
433 
434 /*
435  Handler supports FULLTEXT hints
436 */
437 #define HA_CAN_FULLTEXT_HINTS (1LL << 43)
438 
439 /**
440  Storage engine doesn't support LOCK TABLE ... READ LOCAL locks
441  but doesn't want to use handler::store_lock() API for upgrading
442  them to LOCK TABLE ... READ locks, for example, because it doesn't
443  use THR_LOCK locks at all.
444 */
445 #define HA_NO_READ_LOCAL_LOCK (1LL << 44)
446 
447 /**
448  A storage engine is compatible with the attachable transaction requirements
449  means that
450 
451  - either SE detects the fact that THD::ha_data was reset and starts a new
452  attachable transaction, closes attachable transaction on close_connection
453  and resumes regular (outer) transaction when THD::ha_data is restored;
454 
455  - or SE completely ignores THD::ha_data and close_connection like MyISAM
456  does.
457 */
458 #define HA_ATTACHABLE_TRX_COMPATIBLE (1LL << 45)
459 
460 /**
461  Handler supports Generated Columns
462 */
463 #define HA_GENERATED_COLUMNS (1LL << 46)
464 
465 /**
466  Supports index on virtual generated column
467 */
468 #define HA_CAN_INDEX_VIRTUAL_GENERATED_COLUMN (1LL << 47)
469 
470 /**
471  Supports descending indexes
472 */
473 #define HA_DESCENDING_INDEX (1LL << 48)
474 
475 /**
476  Supports partial update of BLOB columns.
477 */
478 #define HA_BLOB_PARTIAL_UPDATE (1LL << 49)
479 
480 /**
481  If this isn't defined, only columns/indexes with Cartesian coordinate systems
482  (projected SRS or SRID 0) is supported. Columns/indexes without SRID
483  restriction is also supported if this isn't defined.
484 */
485 #define HA_SUPPORTS_GEOGRAPHIC_GEOMETRY_COLUMN (1LL << 50)
486 
487 /**
488  Handler supports expressions as DEFAULT for a column.
489 */
490 #define HA_SUPPORTS_DEFAULT_EXPRESSION (1LL << 51)
491 
492 /**
493  Handlers with this flag set do not support UPDATE operations.
494 */
495 #define HA_UPDATE_NOT_SUPPORTED (1LL << 52)
496 
497 /**
498  Handlers with this flag set do not support DELETE operations.
499 */
500 #define HA_DELETE_NOT_SUPPORTED (1LL << 53)
501 
502 /**
503  The storage engine does not support using indexes for access. Indexes can only
504  be used for estimating cost.
505 */
506 #define HA_NO_INDEX_ACCESS (1LL << 54)
507 
508 /**
509  Supports multi-valued index
510 */
511 #define HA_MULTI_VALUED_KEY_SUPPORT (1LL << 55)
512 
513 /*
514  Bits in index_flags(index_number) for what you can do with index.
515  If you do not implement indexes, just return zero here.
516 */
517 /*
518  Does the index support read next, this is assumed in the server
519  code and never checked so all indexes must support this.
520  Note that the handler can be used even if it doesn't have any index.
521 */
522 #define HA_READ_NEXT 1 /* TODO really use this flag */
523 /*
524  Can the index be used to scan backwards (supports ::index_prev).
525 */
526 #define HA_READ_PREV 2
527 /*
528  Can the index deliver its record in index order. Typically true for
529  all ordered indexes and not true for hash indexes. Used to set keymap
530  part_of_sortkey.
531  This keymap is only used to find indexes usable for resolving an ORDER BY
532  in the query. Thus in most cases index_read will work just fine without
533  order in result production. When this flag is set it is however safe to
534  order all output started by index_read since most engines do this. With
535  read_multi_range calls there is a specific flag setting order or not
536  order so in those cases ordering of index output can be avoided.
537 */
538 #define HA_READ_ORDER 4
539 /*
540  Specify whether index can handle ranges, typically true for all
541  ordered indexes and not true for hash indexes.
542  Used by optimiser to check if ranges (as key >= 5) can be optimised
543  by index.
544 */
545 #define HA_READ_RANGE 8
546 /*
547  Can't use part key searches. This is typically true for hash indexes
548  and typically not true for ordered indexes.
549 */
550 #define HA_ONLY_WHOLE_INDEX 16
551 /*
552  Does the storage engine support index-only scans on this index.
553  Enables use of HA_EXTRA_KEYREAD and HA_EXTRA_NO_KEYREAD
554  Used to set Key_map keys_for_keyread and to check in optimiser for
555  index-only scans. When doing a read under HA_EXTRA_KEYREAD the handler
556  only have to fill in the columns the key covers. If
557  HA_PRIMARY_KEY_IN_READ_INDEX is set then also the PRIMARY KEY columns
558  must be updated in the row.
559 */
560 #define HA_KEYREAD_ONLY 64
561 /*
562  Index scan will not return records in rowid order. Not guaranteed to be
563  set for unordered (e.g. HASH) indexes.
564 */
565 #define HA_KEY_SCAN_NOT_ROR 128
566 #define HA_DO_INDEX_COND_PUSHDOWN 256 /* Supports Index Condition Pushdown */
567 
568 /* operations for disable/enable indexes */
569 #define HA_KEY_SWITCH_NONUNIQ 0
570 #define HA_KEY_SWITCH_ALL 1
571 #define HA_KEY_SWITCH_NONUNIQ_SAVE 2
572 #define HA_KEY_SWITCH_ALL_SAVE 3
573 
574 /*
575  Use this instead of 0 as the initial value for the slot number of
576  handlerton, so that we can distinguish uninitialized slot number
577  from slot 0.
578 */
579 #define HA_SLOT_UNDEF ((uint)-1)
580 
581 /*
582  Parameters for open() (in register form->filestat)
583  HA_GET_INFO does an implicit HA_ABORT_IF_LOCKED
584 */
585 
586 #define HA_OPEN_KEYFILE 1
587 #define HA_OPEN_RNDFILE 2
588 #define HA_GET_INDEX 4
589 #define HA_GET_INFO 8 /* do a handler::info() after open */
590 #define HA_READ_ONLY 16 /* File opened as readonly */
591 /* Try readonly if can't open with read and write */
592 #define HA_TRY_READ_ONLY 32
593 #define HA_WAIT_IF_LOCKED 64 /* Wait if locked on open */
594 #define HA_ABORT_IF_LOCKED 128 /* skip if locked on open.*/
595 #define HA_BLOCK_LOCK 256 /* unlock when reading some records */
596 #define HA_OPEN_TEMPORARY 512
597 
598 /* Some key definitions */
599 #define HA_KEY_NULL_LENGTH 1
600 #define HA_KEY_BLOB_LENGTH 2
601 
602 #define HA_LEX_CREATE_TMP_TABLE 1
603 #define HA_LEX_CREATE_IF_NOT_EXISTS 2
604 #define HA_LEX_CREATE_TABLE_LIKE 4
605 #define HA_LEX_CREATE_INTERNAL_TMP_TABLE 8
606 #define HA_MAX_REC_LENGTH 65535U
607 
608 /**
609  Options for the START TRANSACTION statement.
610 
611  Note that READ ONLY and READ WRITE are logically mutually exclusive.
612  This is enforced by the parser and depended upon by trans_begin().
613 
614  We need two flags instead of one in order to differentiate between
615  situation when no READ WRITE/ONLY clause were given and thus transaction
616  is implicitly READ WRITE and the case when READ WRITE clause was used
617  explicitly.
618 */
619 
620 // WITH CONSISTENT SNAPSHOT option
621 static const uint MYSQL_START_TRANS_OPT_WITH_CONS_SNAPSHOT = 1;
622 // READ ONLY option
623 static const uint MYSQL_START_TRANS_OPT_READ_ONLY = 2;
624 // READ WRITE option
625 static const uint MYSQL_START_TRANS_OPT_READ_WRITE = 4;
626 // HIGH PRIORITY option
627 static const uint MYSQL_START_TRANS_OPT_HIGH_PRIORITY = 8;
628 
629 enum legacy_db_type {
630  DB_TYPE_UNKNOWN = 0,
631  DB_TYPE_DIAB_ISAM = 1,
632  DB_TYPE_HASH,
633  DB_TYPE_MISAM,
634  DB_TYPE_PISAM,
635  DB_TYPE_RMS_ISAM,
636  DB_TYPE_HEAP,
637  DB_TYPE_ISAM,
638  DB_TYPE_MRG_ISAM,
639  DB_TYPE_MYISAM,
640  DB_TYPE_MRG_MYISAM,
641  DB_TYPE_BERKELEY_DB,
642  DB_TYPE_INNODB,
643  DB_TYPE_GEMINI,
644  DB_TYPE_NDBCLUSTER,
645  DB_TYPE_EXAMPLE_DB,
646  DB_TYPE_ARCHIVE_DB,
647  DB_TYPE_CSV_DB,
648  DB_TYPE_FEDERATED_DB,
649  DB_TYPE_BLACKHOLE_DB,
650  DB_TYPE_PARTITION_DB, // No longer used.
651  DB_TYPE_BINLOG,
652  DB_TYPE_SOLID,
653  DB_TYPE_PBXT,
654  DB_TYPE_TABLE_FUNCTION,
655  DB_TYPE_MEMCACHE,
656  DB_TYPE_FALCON,
657  DB_TYPE_MARIA,
658  /** Performance schema engine. */
659  DB_TYPE_PERFORMANCE_SCHEMA,
660  DB_TYPE_TEMPTABLE,
661  DB_TYPE_FIRST_DYNAMIC = 42,
662  DB_TYPE_DEFAULT = 127 // Must be last
663 };
664 
665 enum row_type : int {
666  ROW_TYPE_NOT_USED = -1,
667  ROW_TYPE_DEFAULT,
668  ROW_TYPE_FIXED,
669  ROW_TYPE_DYNAMIC,
670  ROW_TYPE_COMPRESSED,
671  ROW_TYPE_REDUNDANT,
672  ROW_TYPE_COMPACT,
673  /** Unused. Reserved for future versions. */
674  ROW_TYPE_PAGED
675 };
676 
677 enum enum_binlog_func {
678  BFN_RESET_LOGS = 1,
679  BFN_RESET_SLAVE = 2,
680  BFN_BINLOG_WAIT = 3,
681  BFN_BINLOG_END = 4,
682  BFN_BINLOG_PURGE_FILE = 5
683 };
684 
685 enum enum_binlog_command {
686  LOGCOM_CREATE_TABLE,
687  LOGCOM_ALTER_TABLE,
688  LOGCOM_RENAME_TABLE,
689  LOGCOM_DROP_TABLE,
690  LOGCOM_CREATE_DB,
691  LOGCOM_ALTER_DB,
692  LOGCOM_DROP_DB,
693 };
694 
695 enum class enum_sampling_method { SYSTEM, NONE };
696 
697 /* Bits in used_fields */
698 #define HA_CREATE_USED_AUTO (1L << 0)
699 #define HA_CREATE_USED_RAID (1L << 1) // RAID is no longer availble
700 #define HA_CREATE_USED_UNION (1L << 2)
701 #define HA_CREATE_USED_INSERT_METHOD (1L << 3)
702 #define HA_CREATE_USED_MIN_ROWS (1L << 4)
703 #define HA_CREATE_USED_MAX_ROWS (1L << 5)
704 #define HA_CREATE_USED_AVG_ROW_LENGTH (1L << 6)
705 #define HA_CREATE_USED_PACK_KEYS (1L << 7)
706 #define HA_CREATE_USED_CHARSET (1L << 8)
707 #define HA_CREATE_USED_DEFAULT_CHARSET (1L << 9)
708 #define HA_CREATE_USED_DATADIR (1L << 10)
709 #define HA_CREATE_USED_INDEXDIR (1L << 11)
710 #define HA_CREATE_USED_ENGINE (1L << 12)
711 #define HA_CREATE_USED_CHECKSUM (1L << 13)
712 #define HA_CREATE_USED_DELAY_KEY_WRITE (1L << 14)
713 #define HA_CREATE_USED_ROW_FORMAT (1L << 15)
714 #define HA_CREATE_USED_COMMENT (1L << 16)
715 #define HA_CREATE_USED_PASSWORD (1L << 17)
716 #define HA_CREATE_USED_CONNECTION (1L << 18)
717 #define HA_CREATE_USED_KEY_BLOCK_SIZE (1L << 19)
718 /** Unused. Reserved for future versions. */
719 #define HA_CREATE_USED_TRANSACTIONAL (1L << 20)
720 /** Unused. Reserved for future versions. */
721 #define HA_CREATE_USED_PAGE_CHECKSUM (1L << 21)
722 /** This is set whenever STATS_PERSISTENT=0|1|default has been
723 specified in CREATE/ALTER TABLE. See also HA_OPTION_STATS_PERSISTENT in
724 include/my_base.h. It is possible to distinguish whether
725 STATS_PERSISTENT=default has been specified or no STATS_PERSISTENT= is
726 given at all. */
727 #define HA_CREATE_USED_STATS_PERSISTENT (1L << 22)
728 /**
729  This is set whenever STATS_AUTO_RECALC=0|1|default has been
730  specified in CREATE/ALTER TABLE. See enum_stats_auto_recalc.
731  It is possible to distinguish whether STATS_AUTO_RECALC=default
732  has been specified or no STATS_AUTO_RECALC= is given at all.
733 */
734 #define HA_CREATE_USED_STATS_AUTO_RECALC (1L << 23)
735 /**
736  This is set whenever STATS_SAMPLE_PAGES=N|default has been
737  specified in CREATE/ALTER TABLE. It is possible to distinguish whether
738  STATS_SAMPLE_PAGES=default has been specified or no STATS_SAMPLE_PAGES= is
739  given at all.
740 */
741 #define HA_CREATE_USED_STATS_SAMPLE_PAGES (1L << 24)
742 
743 /**
744  This is set whenever a 'TABLESPACE=...' phrase is used on CREATE TABLE
745 */
746 #define HA_CREATE_USED_TABLESPACE (1L << 25)
747 
748 /** COMPRESSION="zlib|lz4|none" used during table create. */
749 #define HA_CREATE_USED_COMPRESS (1L << 26)
750 
751 /** ENCRYPTION="Y" used during table create. */
752 #define HA_CREATE_USED_ENCRYPT (1L << 27)
753 
754 /**
755  CREATE|ALTER SCHEMA|DATABASE|TABLE has an explicit COLLATE clause.
756 
757  Implies HA_CREATE_USED_DEFAULT_CHARSET.
758 */
759 #define HA_CREATE_USED_DEFAULT_COLLATE (1L << 28)
760 
761 /** SECONDARY_ENGINE used during table create. */
762 #define HA_CREATE_USED_SECONDARY_ENGINE (1L << 29)
763 
764 /**
765  CREATE|ALTER SCHEMA|DATABASE has an explicit ENCRYPTION clause.
766 
767  Implies HA_CREATE_USED_DEFAULT_ENCRYPTION.
768 */
769 #define HA_CREATE_USED_DEFAULT_ENCRYPTION (1L << 30)
770 
771 /**
772  This option is used to convey that the create table should not
773  commit the operation and keep the transaction started.
774 */
775 constexpr const uint64_t HA_CREATE_USED_START_TRANSACTION{1ULL << 31};
776 
777 constexpr const uint64_t HA_CREATE_USED_ENGINE_ATTRIBUTE{1ULL << 32};
778 constexpr const uint64_t HA_CREATE_USED_SECONDARY_ENGINE_ATTRIBUTE{1ULL << 33};
779 
780 /**
781  ALTER SCHEMA|DATABASE has an explicit READ_ONLY clause.
782 
783  Implies HA_CREATE_USED_READ_ONLY.
784 */
785 constexpr const uint64_t HA_CREATE_USED_READ_ONLY{1ULL << 34};
786 
787 /*
788  End of bits used in used_fields
789 */
790 
791 /*
792  Structure to hold list of database_name.table_name.
793  This is used at both mysqld and storage engine layer.
794 */
795 struct st_handler_tablename {
796  const char *db;
797  const char *tablename;
798 };
799 
800 #define MAXGTRIDSIZE 64
801 #define MAXBQUALSIZE 64
802 
803 #define COMPATIBLE_DATA_YES 0
804 #define COMPATIBLE_DATA_NO 1
805 
806 /*
807  These structures are used to pass information from a set of SQL commands
808  on add/drop/change tablespace definitions to the proper hton.
809 */
810 #define UNDEF_NODEGROUP 65535
811 
812 // FUTURE: Combine these two enums into one enum class
813 enum ts_command_type {
814  TS_CMD_NOT_DEFINED = -1,
815  CREATE_TABLESPACE = 0,
816  ALTER_TABLESPACE = 1,
817  CREATE_LOGFILE_GROUP = 2,
818  ALTER_LOGFILE_GROUP = 3,
819  DROP_TABLESPACE = 4,
820  DROP_LOGFILE_GROUP = 5,
821  CHANGE_FILE_TABLESPACE = 6,
822  ALTER_ACCESS_MODE_TABLESPACE = 7,
823  CREATE_UNDO_TABLESPACE = 8,
824  ALTER_UNDO_TABLESPACE = 9,
825  DROP_UNDO_TABLESPACE = 10
826 };
827 
828 enum ts_alter_tablespace_type {
829  TS_ALTER_TABLESPACE_TYPE_NOT_DEFINED = -1,
830  ALTER_TABLESPACE_ADD_FILE = 1,
831  ALTER_TABLESPACE_DROP_FILE = 2,
832  ALTER_TABLESPACE_RENAME = 3,
833  ALTER_TABLESPACE_OPTIONS = 4,
834  ALTER_UNDO_TABLESPACE_SET_ACTIVE = 5,
835  ALTER_UNDO_TABLESPACE_SET_INACTIVE = 6
836 };
837 
838 /**
839  Legacy struct for passing tablespace information to SEs.
840 
841  FUTURE: Pass all info through dd objects
842  */
843 class st_alter_tablespace {
844  public:
845  const char *tablespace_name = nullptr;
846  const char *logfile_group_name = nullptr;
847  ts_command_type ts_cmd_type = TS_CMD_NOT_DEFINED;
848  enum ts_alter_tablespace_type ts_alter_tablespace_type =
849  TS_ALTER_TABLESPACE_TYPE_NOT_DEFINED;
850  const char *data_file_name = nullptr;
851  const char *undo_file_name = nullptr;
852  ulonglong extent_size = 1024 * 1024; // Default 1 MByte
853  ulonglong undo_buffer_size = 8 * 1024 * 1024; // Default 8 MByte
854  ulonglong redo_buffer_size = 8 * 1024 * 1024; // Default 8 MByte
855  ulonglong initial_size = 128 * 1024 * 1024; // Default 128 MByte
856  ulonglong autoextend_size = 0; // No autoextension as default
857  ulonglong max_size = 0; // Max size == initial size => no extension
858  ulonglong file_block_size = 0; // 0=default or must be a valid Page Size
859  uint nodegroup_id = UNDEF_NODEGROUP;
860  bool wait_until_completed = true;
861  const char *ts_comment = nullptr;
862 
863  bool is_tablespace_command() {
864  return ts_cmd_type == CREATE_TABLESPACE ||
865  ts_cmd_type == ALTER_TABLESPACE || ts_cmd_type == DROP_TABLESPACE ||
866  ts_cmd_type == CHANGE_FILE_TABLESPACE ||
867  ts_cmd_type == ALTER_ACCESS_MODE_TABLESPACE;
868  }
869 
870  /**
871  Proper constructor even for all-public class simplifies initialization and
872  allows members to be const.
873 
874  FUTURE: With constructor all members can be made const, and do not need
875  default initializers.
876 
877  @param tablespace name of tabelspace (nullptr for logfile group statements)
878  @param logfile_group name of logfile group or nullptr
879  @param cmd main statement type
880  @param alter_tablespace_cmd subcommand type for ALTER TABLESPACE
881  @param datafile tablespace file for CREATE and ALTER ... ADD ...
882  @param undofile only applies to logfile group statements. nullptr otherwise.
883  @param opts options provided by parser
884  */
885  st_alter_tablespace(const char *tablespace, const char *logfile_group,
886  ts_command_type cmd,
887  enum ts_alter_tablespace_type alter_tablespace_cmd,
888  const char *datafile, const char *undofile,
889  const Tablespace_options &opts);
890 };
891 
892 /*
893  Make sure that the order of schema_tables and enum_schema_tables are the same.
894 */
895 enum enum_schema_tables : int {
896  SCH_FIRST = 0,
897  SCH_COLUMN_PRIVILEGES = SCH_FIRST,
898  SCH_ENGINES,
899  SCH_OPEN_TABLES,
900  SCH_OPTIMIZER_TRACE,
901  SCH_PLUGINS,
902  SCH_PROCESSLIST,
903  SCH_PROFILES,
904  SCH_SCHEMA_PRIVILEGES,
905  SCH_TABLESPACES,
906  SCH_TABLE_PRIVILEGES,
907  SCH_USER_PRIVILEGES,
908  SCH_TMP_TABLE_COLUMNS,
909  SCH_TMP_TABLE_KEYS,
910  SCH_LAST = SCH_TMP_TABLE_KEYS
911 };
912 
913 enum ha_stat_type { HA_ENGINE_STATUS, HA_ENGINE_LOGS, HA_ENGINE_MUTEX };
914 enum ha_notification_type : int { HA_NOTIFY_PRE_EVENT, HA_NOTIFY_POST_EVENT };
915 
916 /** Clone start operation mode */
917 enum Ha_clone_mode {
918  /** Start a new clone operation */
919  HA_CLONE_MODE_START,
920 
921  /** Re-start a clone operation after failure */
922  HA_CLONE_MODE_RESTART,
923 
924  /** Add a new task to a running clone operation */
925  HA_CLONE_MODE_ADD_TASK,
926 
927  /** Get version for transfer data format */
928  HA_CLONE_MODE_VERSION,
929 
930  /** Max value for clone mode */
931  HA_CLONE_MODE_MAX
932 };
933 
934 /** Clone operation types. */
935 enum Ha_clone_type : size_t {
936  /** Caller must block all write operation to the SE. */
937  HA_CLONE_BLOCKING,
938 
939  /** For transactional SE, archive redo to support concurrent dml */
940  HA_CLONE_REDO,
941 
942  /** For transactional SE, track page changes to support concurrent dml */
943  HA_CLONE_PAGE,
944 
945  /** For transactional SE, use both page tracking and redo to optimize
946  clone with concurrent dml. Currently supported by Innodb. */
947  HA_CLONE_HYBRID,
948 
949  /** SE supports multiple threads for clone */
950  HA_CLONE_MULTI_TASK,
951 
952  /** SE supports restarting clone after network failure */
953  HA_CLONE_RESTART,
954 
955  /** Maximum value of clone type */
956  HA_CLONE_TYPE_MAX
957 };
958 
959 using Ha_clone_flagset = std::bitset<HA_CLONE_TYPE_MAX>;
960 
961 void set_externally_disabled_storage_engine_names(const char *);
962 bool ha_is_externally_disabled(const handlerton &);
963 
964 /** File reference for clone */
965 struct Ha_clone_file {
966  /** File reference type */
967  enum {
968  /** File handle */
969  FILE_HANDLE,
970 
971  /** File descriptor */
972  FILE_DESC
973 
974  } type;
975 
976  /** File reference */
977  union {
978  /** File descriptor */
979  int file_desc;
980 
981  /** File handle for windows */
982  void *file_handle;
983  };
984 };
985 
986 /* Abstract callback interface to stream data back to the caller. */
987 class Ha_clone_cbk {
988  protected:
989  /** Constructor to initialize members. */
990  Ha_clone_cbk()
991  : m_hton(),
992  m_loc_idx(),
993  m_client_buff_size(),
994  m_data_desc(),
995  m_desc_len(),
996  m_src_name(),
997  m_dest_name(),
998  m_state_estimate(),
999  m_flag() {}
1000 
1001  public:
1002  /** Callback providing data from current position of a
1003  file descriptor of specific length.
1004  @param[in] from_file source file to read from
1005  @param[in] len data length
1006  @return error code */
1007  virtual int file_cbk(Ha_clone_file from_file, uint len) = 0;
1008 
1009  /** Callback providing data in buffer of specific length.
1010  @param[in] from_buffer source buffer to read from
1011  @param[in] len data length
1012  @return error code */
1013  virtual int buffer_cbk(uchar *from_buffer, uint len) = 0;
1014 
1015  /** Callback providing a file descriptor to write data starting
1016  from current position.
1017  @param[in] to_file destination file to write data
1018  @return error code */
1019  virtual int apply_file_cbk(Ha_clone_file to_file) = 0;
1020 
1021  /** Callback to get data in buffer.
1022  @param[out] to_buffer data buffer
1023  @param[out] len data length
1024  @return error code */
1025  virtual int apply_buffer_cbk(uchar *&to_buffer, uint &len) = 0;
1026 
1027  /** virtual destructor. */
1028  virtual ~Ha_clone_cbk() {}
1029 
1030  /** Set current storage engine handlerton.
1031  @param[in] hton SE handlerton */
1032  void set_hton(handlerton *hton) { m_hton = hton; }
1033 
1034  /** Get current storage engine handlerton.
1035  @return SE handlerton */
1036  handlerton *get_hton() { return (m_hton); }
1037 
1038  /** Set caller's transfer buffer size. SE can adjust the data chunk size
1039  based on this parameter.
1040  @param[in] size buffer size in bytes */
1041  void set_client_buffer_size(uint size) { m_client_buff_size = size; }
1042 
1043  /** Get caller's transfer buffer size.
1044  @return buffer size in bytes */
1045  uint get_client_buffer_size() { return (m_client_buff_size); }
1046 
1047  /** Set current SE index.
1048  @param[in] idx SE index in locator array */
1049  void set_loc_index(uint idx) { m_loc_idx = idx; }
1050 
1051  /** Get current SE index.
1052  @return SE index in locator array */
1053  uint get_loc_index() { return (m_loc_idx); }
1054 
1055  /** Set data descriptor. SE specific descriptor for the
1056  data transferred by the callbacks.
1057  @param[in] desc serialized data descriptor
1058  @param[in] len length of the descriptor byte stream */
1059  void set_data_desc(const uchar *desc, uint len) {
1060  m_data_desc = desc;
1061  m_desc_len = len;
1062  }
1063 
1064  /** Get data descriptor. SE specific descriptor for the
1065  data transferred by the callbacks.
1066  @param[out] lenp length of the descriptor byte stream
1067  @return pointer to the serialized data descriptor */
1068  const uchar *get_data_desc(uint *lenp) {
1069  if (lenp != nullptr) {
1070  *lenp = m_desc_len;
1071  }
1072 
1073  return (m_data_desc);
1074  }
1075 
1076  /** Get SE source file name. Used for debug printing and error message.
1077  @return null terminated string for source file name */
1078  const char *get_source_name() { return (m_src_name); }
1079 
1080  /** Set SE source file name.
1081  @param[in] name null terminated string for source file name */
1082  void set_source_name(const char *name) { m_src_name = name; }
1083 
1084  /** Get SE destination file name. Used for debug printing and error message.
1085  @return null terminated string for destination file name */
1086  const char *get_dest_name() { return (m_dest_name); }
1087 
1088  /** Set SE destination file name.
1089  @param[in] name null terminated string for destination file name */
1090  void set_dest_name(const char *name) { m_dest_name = name; }
1091 
1092  /** Clear all flags set by SE */
1093  void clear_flags() { m_flag = 0; }
1094 
1095  /** Mark that ACK is needed for the data transfer before returning
1096  from callback. Set by SE. */
1097  void set_ack() { m_flag |= HA_CLONE_ACK; }
1098 
1099  /** Check if ACK is needed for the data transfer
1100  @return true if ACK is needed */
1101  bool is_ack_needed() const { return (m_flag & HA_CLONE_ACK); }
1102 
1103  /** Mark that the file descriptor is opened for read/write
1104  with OS buffer cache. For O_DIRECT, the flag is not set. */
1105  void set_os_buffer_cache() { m_flag |= HA_CLONE_FILE_CACHE; }
1106 
1107  /** Check if the file descriptor is opened for read/write with OS
1108  buffer cache. Currently clone avoids using zero copy (sendfile on linux),
1109  if SE is using O_DIRECT. This improves data copy performance.
1110  @return true if O_DIRECT is not used */
1111  bool is_os_buffer_cache() const { return (m_flag & HA_CLONE_FILE_CACHE); }
1112 
1113  /** Mark that the file can be transferred with zero copy. */
1114  void set_zero_copy() { m_flag |= HA_CLONE_ZERO_COPY; }
1115 
1116  /** Check if zero copy optimization is suggested. */
1117  bool is_zero_copy() const { return (m_flag & HA_CLONE_ZERO_COPY); }
1118 
1119  /** Mark that data needs secure transfer. */
1120  void set_secure() { m_flag |= HA_CLONE_SECURE; }
1121 
1122  /** Check if data needs secure transfer. */
1123  bool is_secure() const { return (m_flag & HA_CLONE_SECURE); }
1124 
1125  /** Set state information and notify state change.
1126  @param[in] estimate estimated bytes for current state. */
1127  void mark_state_change(uint64_t estimate) {
1128  m_flag |= HA_CLONE_STATE_CHANGE;
1129  m_state_estimate = estimate;
1130  }
1131 
1132  /** Check if SE notified state change. */
1133  bool is_state_change(uint64_t &estimate) {
1134  estimate = m_state_estimate;
1135  return (m_flag & HA_CLONE_STATE_CHANGE);
1136  }
1137 
1138  private:
1139  /** Handlerton for the SE */
1140  handlerton *m_hton;
1141 
1142  /** SE index in caller's locator array */
1143  uint m_loc_idx;
1144 
1145  /** Caller's transfer buffer size. */
1146  uint m_client_buff_size;
1147 
1148  /** SE's Serialized data descriptor */
1149  const uchar *m_data_desc;
1150 
1151  /** SE's Serialized descriptor length. */
1152  uint m_desc_len;
1153 
1154  /** Current source file name */
1155  const char *m_src_name;
1156 
1157  /** Current destination file name */
1158  const char *m_dest_name;
1159 
1160  /** Estimated bytes to be transferred. */
1161  uint64_t m_state_estimate;
1162 
1163  /** Flag storing data related options */
1164  int m_flag;
1165 
1166  /** Acknowledgement is needed for the data transfer. */
1167  const int HA_CLONE_ACK = 0x01;
1168 
1169  /** Data file is opened for read/write with OS buffer cache. */
1170  const int HA_CLONE_FILE_CACHE = 0x02;
1171 
1172  /** Data file can be transferred with zero copy. */
1173  const int HA_CLONE_ZERO_COPY = 0x04;
1174 
1175  /** Data needs to be transferred securely over SSL connection. */
1176  const int HA_CLONE_SECURE = 0x08;
1177 
1178  /** State change notification by SE. */
1179  const int HA_CLONE_STATE_CHANGE = 0x10;
1180 };
1181 
1182 /**
1183  Column type description for foreign key columns compatibility check.
1184 
1185  Contains subset of information from dd::Column class. It is inconvenient
1186  to use dd::Column class directly for such checks because it requires valid
1187  dd::Table object and in some cases we want to produce Ha_fk_column_type
1188  right from column description in Create_field format.
1189 */
1190 struct Ha_fk_column_type {
1191  dd::enum_column_types type;
1192  /*
1193  Note that both dd::Column::char_length() and length here are really
1194  in bytes.
1195  */
1196  size_t char_length;
1197  const CHARSET_INFO *field_charset;
1198  size_t elements_count;
1199  uint numeric_scale;
1200  bool is_unsigned;
1201 };
1202 
1203 /* handlerton methods */
1204 
1205 /**
1206  close_connection is only called if
1207  thd->ha_data[xxx_hton.slot] is non-zero, so even if you don't need
1208  this storage area - set it to something, so that MySQL would know
1209  this storage engine was accessed in this connection
1210 */
1211 typedef int (*close_connection_t)(handlerton *hton, THD *thd);
1212 
1213 /** Terminate connection/statement notification. */
1214 typedef void (*kill_connection_t)(handlerton *hton, THD *thd);
1215 
1216 /**
1217  Shut down all storage engine background tasks that might access
1218  the data dictionary, before the main shutdown.
1219 */
1220 typedef void (*pre_dd_shutdown_t)(handlerton *hton);
1221 
1222 /**
1223  sv points to a storage area, that was earlier passed
1224  to the savepoint_set call
1225 */
1226 typedef int (*savepoint_rollback_t)(handlerton *hton, THD *thd, void *sv);
1227 
1228 /**
1229  sv points to an uninitialized storage area of requested size
1230  (see savepoint_offset description)
1231 */
1232 typedef int (*savepoint_set_t)(handlerton *hton, THD *thd, void *sv);
1233 
1234 /**
1235  Check if storage engine allows to release metadata locks which were
1236  acquired after the savepoint if rollback to savepoint is done.
1237  @return true - If it is safe to release MDL locks.
1238  false - If it is not.
1239 */
1240 typedef bool (*savepoint_rollback_can_release_mdl_t)(handlerton *hton,
1241  THD *thd);
1242 
1243 typedef int (*savepoint_release_t)(handlerton *hton, THD *thd, void *sv);
1244 
1245 /**
1246  'all' is true if it's a real commit, that makes persistent changes
1247  'all' is false if it's not in fact a commit but an end of the
1248  statement that is part of the transaction.
1249  NOTE 'all' is also false in auto-commit mode where 'end of statement'
1250  and 'real commit' mean the same event.
1251 */
1252 typedef int (*commit_t)(handlerton *hton, THD *thd, bool all);
1253 
1254 typedef int (*rollback_t)(handlerton *hton, THD *thd, bool all);
1255 
1256 typedef int (*prepare_t)(handlerton *hton, THD *thd, bool all);
1257 
1258 typedef int (*recover_t)(handlerton *hton, XA_recover_txn *xid_list, uint len,
1259  MEM_ROOT *mem_root);
1260 
1261 /** X/Open XA distributed transaction status codes */
1262 enum xa_status_code {
1263  /**
1264  normal execution
1265  */
1266  XA_OK = 0,
1267 
1268  /**
1269  asynchronous operation already outstanding
1270  */
1271  XAER_ASYNC = -2,
1272 
1273  /**
1274  a resource manager error occurred in the transaction branch
1275  */
1276  XAER_RMERR = -3,
1277 
1278  /**
1279  the XID is not valid
1280  */
1281  XAER_NOTA = -4,
1282 
1283  /**
1284  invalid arguments were given
1285  */
1286  XAER_INVAL = -5,
1287 
1288  /**
1289  routine invoked in an improper context
1290  */
1291  XAER_PROTO = -6,
1292 
1293  /**
1294  resource manager unavailable
1295  */
1296  XAER_RMFAIL = -7,
1297 
1298  /**
1299  the XID already exists
1300  */
1301  XAER_DUPID = -8,
1302 
1303  /**
1304  resource manager doing work outside transaction
1305  */
1306  XAER_OUTSIDE = -9
1307 };
1308 
1309 typedef xa_status_code (*commit_by_xid_t)(handlerton *hton, XID *xid);
1310 
1311 typedef xa_status_code (*rollback_by_xid_t)(handlerton *hton, XID *xid);
1312 
1313 /**
1314  Create handler object for the table in the storage engine.
1315 
1316  @param hton Handlerton object for the storage engine.
1317  @param table TABLE_SHARE for the table, can be NULL if caller
1318  didn't perform full-blown open of table definition.
1319  @param partitioned Indicates whether table is partitioned.
1320  @param mem_root Memory root to be used for allocating handler
1321  object.
1322 */
1323 typedef handler *(*create_t)(handlerton *hton, TABLE_SHARE *table,
1324  bool partitioned, MEM_ROOT *mem_root);
1325 
1326 typedef void (*drop_database_t)(handlerton *hton, char *path);
1327 
1328 typedef int (*panic_t)(handlerton *hton, enum ha_panic_function flag);
1329 
1330 typedef int (*start_consistent_snapshot_t)(handlerton *hton, THD *thd);
1331 
1332 /**
1333  Flush the log(s) of storage engine(s).
1334 
1335  @param hton Handlerton of storage engine.
1336  @param binlog_group_flush true if we got invoked by binlog group
1337  commit during flush stage, false in other cases.
1338  @retval false Succeed
1339  @retval true Error
1340 */
1341 typedef bool (*flush_logs_t)(handlerton *hton, bool binlog_group_flush);
1342 
1343 typedef bool (*show_status_t)(handlerton *hton, THD *thd, stat_print_fn *print,
1344  enum ha_stat_type stat);
1345 
1346 /**
1347  The flag values are defined in sql_partition.h.
1348  If this function is set, then it implies that the handler supports
1349  partitioned tables.
1350  If this function exists, then handler::get_partition_handler must also be
1351  implemented.
1352 */
1353 typedef uint (*partition_flags_t)();
1354 
1355 /**
1356  SE specific validation of the tablespace name.
1357 
1358  This function will ask the relevant SE whether the submitted tablespace
1359  name is valid.
1360 
1361  @param ts_cmd Purpose of usage - is this tablespace DDL?
1362  @param tablespace_name Name of the tablespace.
1363 
1364  @return Tablespace name validity.
1365  @retval Whether the tablespace name is valid.
1366 */
1367 typedef bool (*is_valid_tablespace_name_t)(ts_command_type ts_cmd,
1368  const char *tablespace_name);
1369 
1370 /**
1371  Get the tablespace name from the SE for the given schema and table.
1372 
1373  @param thd Thread context.
1374  @param db_name Name of the relevant schema.
1375  @param table_name Name of the relevant table.
1376  @param [out] tablespace_name Name of the tablespace containing the table.
1377 
1378  @return Operation status.
1379  @retval == 0 Success.
1380  @retval != 0 Error (handler error code returned).
1381 */
1382 typedef int (*get_tablespace_t)(THD *thd, LEX_CSTRING db_name,
1383  LEX_CSTRING table_name,
1384  LEX_CSTRING *tablespace_name);
1385 
1386 /**
1387  Create/drop or alter tablespace in the storage engine.
1388 
1389  @param hton Hadlerton of the SE.
1390  @param thd Thread context.
1391  @param ts_info Description of tablespace and specific
1392  operation on it.
1393  @param old_ts_def dd::Tablespace object describing old version
1394  of tablespace.
1395  @param [in,out] new_ts_def dd::Tablespace object describing new version
1396  of tablespace. Engines which support atomic DDL
1397  can adjust this object. The updated information
1398  will be saved to the data-dictionary.
1399 
1400  @return Operation status.
1401  @retval == 0 Success.
1402  @retval != 0 Error (handler error code returned).
1403 */
1404 typedef int (*alter_tablespace_t)(handlerton *hton, THD *thd,
1405  st_alter_tablespace *ts_info,
1406  const dd::Tablespace *old_ts_def,
1407  dd::Tablespace *new_ts_def);
1408 
1409 /**
1410  SE interface for getting tablespace extension.
1411  @return Extension of tablespace datafile name.
1412 */
1413 typedef const char *(*get_tablespace_filename_ext_t)();
1414 
1415 /**
1416  Get the tablespace data from SE and insert it into Data dictionary
1417 
1418  @param thd Thread context
1419 
1420  @return Operation status.
1421  @retval == 0 Success.
1422  @retval != 0 Error (handler error code returned)
1423 */
1424 typedef int (*upgrade_tablespace_t)(THD *thd);
1425 
1426 /**
1427  Get the tablespace data from SE and insert it into Data dictionary
1428

1430 
1431  @return Operation status.
1432  @retval == 0 Success.
1433  @retval != 0 Error (handler error code returned)
1434 */
1435 typedef bool (*upgrade_space_version_t)(dd::Tablespace *tablespace);
1436 
1437 /**

1440  and cleanup after upgrade.

1443 
1444  @return Operation status.
1445  @retval == 0 Success.
1446  @retval != 0 Error (handler error code returned)
1447 */
1448 typedef int (*finish_upgrade_t)(THD *thd, bool failed_upgrade);
1449 
1450 /**
1451  Upgrade logs after the checkpoint from where upgrade
1452  process can only roll forward.
1453 
1454  @param thd Thread context
1455 
1456  @return Operation status.
1457  @retval == 0 Success.
1458  @retval != 0 Error (handler error code returned)
1459 */
1460 typedef int (*upgrade_logs_t)(THD *thd);
1461 
1462 enum class Tablespace_type {
1463  SPACE_TYPE_DICTIONARY,
1464  SPACE_TYPE_SYSTEM,
1465  SPACE_TYPE_UNDO,
1466  SPACE_TYPE_TEMPORARY,
1467  SPACE_TYPE_SHARED,
1468  SPACE_TYPE_IMPLICIT
1469 };
1470 
1471 /**
1472  Get the tablespace type from the SE.
1473

1476 
1477  @return Operation status.
1478  @retval false on success and true for failure.
1479 */
1480 typedef bool (*get_tablespace_type_t)(const dd::Tablespace &space,
1481  Tablespace_type *space_type);

1487  @param[out] space_type type of space

1491 */
1492 typedef bool (*get_tablespace_type_by_name_t)(const char *tablespace_name,
1493  Tablespace_type *space_type);

1499  void *arg);

1504  const char *db, const char *table_name);

1510  const char *name, uchar **frmblob, size_t *frmlen);

1513  const char *path, const char *wild, bool dir,
1514  List<LEX_STRING> *files);

1517  const char *db, const char *name);
1518 
1519 /**
1520  Check if the given db.tablename is a system table for this SE.
1521 
1522  @param db Database name to check.
1523  @param table_name table name to check.
1524  @param is_sql_layer_system_table if the supplied db.table_name is a SQL
1525  layer system table.
1526 
1527  @see example_is_supported_system_table in ha_example.cc
1528 
1529  is_sql_layer_system_table is supplied to make more efficient
1530  checks possible for SEs that support all SQL layer tables.
1531 
1532  This interface is optional, so every SE need not implement it.
1533 */
1534 typedef bool (*is_supported_system_table_t)(const char *db,
1535  const char *table_name,
1536  bool is_sql_layer_system_table);
1537 
1538 /**
1539  Create SDI in a tablespace. This API should be used when upgrading
1540  a tablespace with no SDI or after invoking sdi_drop().
1541  @param[in] tablespace tablespace object
1542  @retval false success
1543  @retval true failure
1544 */
1545 typedef bool (*sdi_create_t)(dd::Tablespace *tablespace);
1546 
1547 /**
1548  Drop SDI in a tablespace. This API should be used only when
1549  SDI is corrupted.
1550  @param[in] tablespace tablespace object
1551  @retval false success
1552  @retval true failure
1553 */
1554 typedef bool (*sdi_drop_t)(dd::Tablespace *tablespace);
1555 
1556 /**
1557  Get the SDI keys in a tablespace into vector.
1558  @param[in] tablespace tablespace object
1559  @param[in,out] vector vector of SDI Keys
1560  @retval false success
1561  @retval true failure
1562 */
1563 typedef bool (*sdi_get_keys_t)(const dd::Tablespace &tablespace,
1564  sdi_vector_t &vector);
1565 
1566 /**
1567  Retrieve SDI for a given SDI key.
1568 
1569  Since the caller of this api will not know the SDI length, SDI retrieval
1570  should be done in the following way.
1571 
1572  i. Allocate initial memory of some size (Lets say 64KB)
1573  ii. Pass the allocated memory to the below api.
1574  iii. If passed buffer is sufficient, sdi_get_by_id() copies the sdi
1575  to the buffer passed and returns success, else sdi_len is modified
1576  with the actual length of the SDI (and returns false on failure).
1577  For genuine errors, sdi_len is returned as UINT64_MAX
1578  iv. If sdi_len != UINT64_MAX, retry the call after allocating the memory
1579  of sdi_len
1580  v. Free the memory after using SDI (responsibility of caller)
1581 
1582  @param[in] tablespace tablespace object
1583  @param[in] sdi_key SDI key to uniquely identify SDI obj
1584  @param[in,out] sdi SDI retrieved from tablespace
1585  A non-null pointer must be passed in
1586  @param[in,out] sdi_len in: length of the memory allocated
1587  out: actual length of SDI
1588  @retval false success
1589  @retval true failure
1590 */
1591 typedef bool (*sdi_get_t)(const dd::Tablespace &tablespace,
1592  const sdi_key_t *sdi_key, void *sdi, uint64 *sdi_len);
1593 
1594 /**
1595  Insert/Update SDI for a given SDI key.
1596  @param[in] hton handlerton object
1597  @param[in] tablespace tablespace object
1598  @param[in] sdi_key SDI key to uniquely identify SDI obj
1599  @param[in] sdi SDI to write into the tablespace
1600  @param[in] sdi_len length of SDI BLOB returned
1601  @retval false success
1602  @retval true failure, my_error() should be called
1603  by SE
1604 */
1605 typedef bool (*sdi_set_t)(handlerton *hton, const dd::Tablespace &tablespace,
1606  const dd::Table *table, const sdi_key_t *sdi_key,
1607  const void *sdi, uint64 sdi_len);
1608 
1609 /**
1610  Delete SDI for a given SDI key.
1611  @param[in] tablespace tablespace object
1612  @param[in] sdi_key SDI key to uniquely identify SDI obj
1613  @retval false success
1614  @retval true failure, my_error() should be called
1615  by SE
1616 */
1617 typedef bool (*sdi_delete_t)(const dd::Tablespace &tablespace,
1618  const dd::Table *table, const sdi_key_t *sdi_key);
1619 
1620 /**
1621  Check if the DDSE is started in a way that leaves thd DD being read only.
1622 
1623  @retval true The data dictionary can only be read.
1624  @retval false The data dictionary can be read and written.
1625  */
1626 typedef bool (*is_dict_readonly_t)();
1627 
1628 /**
1629  Drop all temporary tables which have been left from previous server
1630  run belonging to this SE. Used on server start-up.
1631 
1632  @param[in] hton Handlerton for storage engine.
1633  @param[in] thd Thread context.
1634  @param[in,out] files List of files in directories for temporary files
1635  which match tmp_file_prefix and thus can belong to
1636  temporary tables (but not necessarily in this SE).
1637  It is recommended to remove file from the list if
1638  SE recognizes it as belonging to temporary table
1639  in this SE and deletes it.
1640 */
1641 typedef bool (*rm_tmp_tables_t)(handlerton *hton, THD *thd,
1642  List<LEX_STRING> *files);
1643 
1644 /**
1645  Retrieve cost constants to be used for this storage engine.
1646 
1647  A storage engine that wants to provide its own cost constants to
1648  be used in the optimizer cost model, should implement this function.
1649  The server will call this function to get a cost constant object
1650  that will be used for tables stored in this storage engine instead
1651  of using the default cost constants.
1652 
1653  Life cycle for the cost constant object: The storage engine must
1654  allocate the cost constant object on the heap. After the function
1655  returns, the server takes over the ownership of this object.
1656  The server will eventually delete the object by calling delete.
1657 
1658  @note In the initial version the storage_category parameter will
1659  not be used. The only valid value this will have is DEFAULT_STORAGE_CLASS
1660  (see declaration in opt_costconstants.h).
1661 
1662  @param storage_category the storage type that the cost constants will
1663  be used for
1664 
1665  @return a pointer to the cost constant object, if NULL is returned
1666  the default cost constants will be used
1667 */
1668 typedef SE_cost_constants *(*get_cost_constants_t)(uint storage_category);
1669 
1670 /**
1671  @param[in,out] thd pointer to THD
1672  @param[in] new_trx_arg pointer to replacement transaction
1673  @param[out] ptr_trx_arg double pointer to being replaced transaction
1674 
1675  Associated with THD engine's native transaction is replaced
1676  with @c new_trx_arg. The old value is returned through a buffer if non-null
1677  pointer is provided with @c ptr_trx_arg.
1678  The method is adapted by XA start and XA prepare handlers to
1679  handle XA transaction that is logged as two parts by slave applier.
1680 
1681  This interface concerns engines that are aware of XA transaction.
1682 */
1683 typedef void (*replace_native_transaction_in_thd_t)(THD *thd, void *new_trx_arg,
1684  void **ptr_trx_arg);
1685 
1686 /** Mode for initializing the data dictionary. */
1687 enum dict_init_mode_t {
1688  DICT_INIT_CREATE_FILES, ///< Create all required SE files
1689  DICT_INIT_CHECK_FILES, ///< Verify existence of expected files
1690  DICT_INIT_UPGRADE_57_FILES, ///< Used for upgrade from mysql-5.7
1691  DICT_INIT_IGNORE_FILES ///< Don't care about files at all
1692 };
1693 
1694 /**
1695  Initialize the SE for being used to store the DD tables. Create
1696  the required files according to the dict_init_mode. Create strings
1697  representing the required DDSE tables, i.e., tables that the DDSE
1698  expects to exist in the DD, and add them to the appropriate out
1699  parameter.
1700 
1701  @note There are two variants of this function type, one is to be
1702  used by the DDSE, and has a different type of output parameters
1703  because the SQL layer needs more information about the DDSE tables
1704  in order to support upgrade.
1705 
1706  @param dict_init_mode How to initialize files
1707  @param version Target DD version if a new
1708  server is being installed.
1709  0 if restarting an existing
1710  server.
1711  @param [out] DDSE_tables List of SQL DDL statements
1712  for creating DD tables that
1713  are needed by the DDSE.
1714  @param [out] DDSE_tablespaces List of meta data for predefined
1715  tablespaces created by the DDSE.
1716 
1717  @retval true An error occurred.
1718  @retval false Success - no errors.
1719  */
1720 
1721 typedef bool (*dict_init_t)(dict_init_mode_t dict_init_mode, uint version,
1722  List<const Plugin_table> *DDSE_tables,
1723  List<const Plugin_tablespace> *DDSE_tablespaces);
1724 
1725 typedef bool (*ddse_dict_init_t)(
1726  dict_init_mode_t dict_init_mode, uint version,
1727  List<const dd::Object_table> *DDSE_tables,
1728  List<const Plugin_tablespace> *DDSE_tablespaces);
1729 
1730 /**
1731  Initialize the set of hard coded DD table ids.
1732 */
1733 typedef void (*dict_register_dd_table_id_t)(dd::Object_id hard_coded_tables);
1734 
1735 /**
1736  Invalidate an entry in the local dictionary cache.
1737 
1738  Needed during bootstrap to make sure the contents in the DDSE
1739  dictionary cache is in sync with the global DD.
1740 
1741  @param schema_name Schema name.
1742  @param table_name Table name.
1743  */
1744 
1745 typedef void (*dict_cache_reset_t)(const char *schema_name,
1746  const char *table_name);
1747 
1748 /**
1749  Invalidate all table and tablespace entries in the local dictionary cache.
1750 
1751  Needed for recovery during server restart.
1752  */
1753 
1754 typedef void (*dict_cache_reset_tables_and_tablespaces_t)();
1755 
1756 /** Mode for data dictionary recovery. */
1757 enum dict_recovery_mode_t {
1758  DICT_RECOVERY_INITIALIZE_SERVER, ///< First start of a new server
1759  DICT_RECOVERY_INITIALIZE_TABLESPACES, ///< First start, create tablespaces
1760  DICT_RECOVERY_RESTART_SERVER ///< Restart of an existing server
1761 };
1762 
1763 /**
1764  Do recovery in the DDSE as part of initializing the data dictionary.
1765  The dict_recovery_mode indicates what kind of recovery should be
1766  done.
1767 
1768  @param dict_recovery_mode How to do recovery
1769  @param version Target DD version if a new
1770  server is being installed.
1771  Actual DD version if restarting
1772  an existing server.
1773 
1774  @retval true An error occurred.
1775  @retval false Success - no errors.
1776  */
1777 
1778 typedef bool (*dict_recover_t)(dict_recovery_mode_t dict_recovery_mode,
1779  uint version);
1780 
1781 /**
1782  Get the server version id stored in the header of the
1783  dictionary tablespace.
1784 
1785  @param [out] version Version number from the DD
1786  tablespace header.
1787 
1788  @retval Operation outcome, false if no error, otherwise true.
1789 */
1790 typedef bool (*dict_get_server_version_t)(uint *version);
1791 
1792 /**
1793  Store the current server version number into the
1794  header of the dictionary tablespace.
1795 
1796  @retval Operation outcome, false if no error, otherwise true.
1797 */
1798 typedef bool (*dict_set_server_version_t)();
1799 
1800 /**
1801  Notify/get permission from storage engine before acquisition or after
1802  release of exclusive metadata lock on object represented by key.
1803 
1804  @param thd Thread context.
1805  @param mdl_key MDL key identifying object on which exclusive
1806  lock is to be acquired/was released.
1807  @param notification_type Indicates whether this is pre-acquire or
1808  post-release notification.
1809  @param victimized 'true' if locking failed as we were selected
1810  as a victim in order to avoid possible deadlocks.
1811 
1812  @note Notification is done only for objects from TABLESPACE, SCHEMA,
1813  TABLE, FUNCTION, PROCEDURE, TRIGGER and EVENT namespaces.
1814 
1815  @note Problems during notification are to be reported as warnings, MDL
1816  subsystem will report generic error if pre-acquire notification
1817  fails/SE refuses lock acquisition.
1818  @note Return value is ignored/error is not reported in case of
1819  post-release notification.
1820 
1821  @note In some cases post-release notification might happen even if
1822  there were no prior pre-acquire notification. For example,
1823  when SE was loaded after exclusive lock acquisition, or when
1824  we need notify SEs which permitted lock acquisition that it
1825  didn't happen because one of SEs didn't allow it (in such case
1826  we will do post-release notification for all SEs for simplicity).
1827 
1828  @return False - if notification was successful/lock can be acquired,
1829  True - if it has failed/lock should not be acquired.
1830 */
1831 typedef bool (*notify_exclusive_mdl_t)(THD *thd, const MDL_key *mdl_key,
1832  ha_notification_type notification_type,
1833  bool *victimized);
1834 
1835 /**
1836  Notify/get permission from storage engine before or after execution of
1837  ALTER TABLE operation on the table identified by the MDL key.
1838 
1839  @param thd Thread context.
1840  @param mdl_key MDL key identifying table which is going to be
1841  or was ALTERed.
1842  @param notification_type Indicates whether this is pre-ALTER TABLE or
1843  post-ALTER TABLE notification.
1844 
1845  @note This hook is necessary because for ALTER TABLE upgrade to X
1846  metadata lock happens fairly late during the execution process,
1847  so it can be expensive to abort ALTER TABLE operation at this
1848  stage by returning failure from notify_exclusive_mdl() hook.
1849 
1850  @note This hook follows the same error reporting convention as
1851  @see notify_exclusive_mdl().
1852 
1853  @note Similarly to notify_exclusive_mdl() in some cases post-ALTER
1854  notification might happen even if there were no prior pre-ALTER
1855  notification.
1856 
1857  @note Post-ALTER notification can happen before post-release notification
1858  for exclusive metadata lock acquired by this ALTER TABLE.
1859 
1860  @return False - if notification was successful/ALTER TABLE can proceed.
1861  True - if it has failed/ALTER TABLE should be aborted.
1862 */
1863 typedef bool (*notify_alter_table_t)(THD *thd, const MDL_key *mdl_key,
1864  ha_notification_type notification_type);
1865 
1866 /**
1867  @brief
1868  Initiate master key rotation
1869 
1870  @returns false on success,
1871  true on failure
1872 */
1873 typedef bool (*rotate_encryption_master_key_t)(void);
1874 
1875 /**
1876  @brief
1877  Enable or Disable SE write ahead logging.
1878 
1879  @param[in] thd server thread handle
1880  @param[in] enable enable/disable redo logging
1881 
1882  @return true iff failed.
1883 */
1884 typedef bool (*redo_log_set_state_t)(THD *thd, bool enable);
1885 
1886 /**
1887  @brief
1888  Retrieve ha_statistics from SE.
1889 
1890  @param db_name Name of schema
1891  @param table_name Name of table
1892  @param se_private_id SE private id of the table.
1893  @param ts_se_private_data Tablespace SE private data.
1894  @param tbl_se_private_data Table SE private data.
1895  @param flags Type of statistics to retrieve.
1896  @param[out] stats Contains statistics read from SE.
1897 
1898  @note Handlers that implement this callback/API should adhere
1899  to servers expectation that, the implementation would invoke
1900  my_error() before returning 'true'/failure from this function.
1901 
1902  @returns false on success,
1903  true on failure
1904 */
1905 typedef bool (*get_table_statistics_t)(
1906  const char *db_name, const char *table_name, dd::Object_id se_private_id,
1907  const dd::Properties &ts_se_private_data,
1908  const dd::Properties &tbl_se_private_data, uint flags,
1909  ha_statistics *stats);
1910 
1911 /**
1912  @brief
1913  Retrieve index column cardinality from SE.
1914 
1915  @param db_name Name of schema
1916  @param table_name Name of table
1917  @param index_name Name of index
1918  @param index_ordinal_position Position of index.
1919  @param column_ordinal_position Position of column in index.
1920  @param se_private_id SE private id of the table.
1921  @param[out] cardinality cardinality being returned by SE.
1922 
1923  @note Handlers that implement this callback/API should adhere
1924  to servers expectation that, the implementation would invoke
1925  my_error() before returning 'true'/failure from this function.
1926 
1927  @returns false on success,
1928  true on failure
1929 */
1930 typedef bool (*get_index_column_cardinality_t)(
1931  const char *db_name, const char *table_name, const char *index_name,
1932  uint index_ordinal_position, uint column_ordinal_position,
1933  dd::Object_id se_private_id, ulonglong *cardinality);
1934 
1935 /**
1936  Retrieve ha_tablespace_statistics from SE.
1937 
1938  @param tablespace_name Tablespace_name
1939  @param file_name Tablespace file name.
1940  @param ts_se_private_data Tablespace SE private data.
1941  @param[out] stats Contains tablespace
1942  statistics read from SE.
1943 
1944  @note Handlers that implement this callback/API should adhere
1945  to servers expectation that, the implementation would invoke
1946  my_error() before returning 'true'/failure from this function.
1947 
1948  @returns false on success, true on failure
1949 */
1950 typedef bool (*get_tablespace_statistics_t)(
1951  const char *tablespace_name, const char *file_name,
1952  const dd::Properties &ts_se_private_data, ha_tablespace_statistics *stats);
1953 
1954 /* Database physical clone interfaces */
1955 
1956 /** Get capability flags for clone operation
1957 @param[out] flags capability flag */
1958 using Clone_capability_t = void (*)(Ha_clone_flagset &flags);
1959 
1960 /** Begin copy from source database
1961 @param[in] hton handlerton for SE
1962 @param[in] thd server thread handle
1963 @param[in,out] loc locator
1964 @param[in,out] loc_len locator length
1965 @param[out] task_id task identifier
1966 @param[in] type clone type
1967 @param[in] mode mode for starting clone
1968 @return error code */
1969 using Clone_begin_t = int (*)(handlerton *hton, THD *thd, const uchar *&loc,
1970  uint &loc_len, uint &task_id, Ha_clone_type type,
1971  Ha_clone_mode mode);
1972 
1973 /** Copy data from source database in chunks via callback
1974 @param[in] hton handlerton for SE
1975 @param[in] thd server thread handle
1976 @param[in] loc locator
1977 @param[in] loc_len locator length in bytes
1978 @param[in] task_id task identifier
1979 @param[in] cbk callback interface for sending data
1980 @return error code */
1981 using Clone_copy_t = int (*)(handlerton *hton, THD *thd, const uchar *loc,
1982  uint loc_len, uint task_id, Ha_clone_cbk *cbk);
1983 
1984 /** Acknowledge data transfer to source database
1985 @param[in] hton handlerton for SE
1986 @param[in] thd server thread handle
1987 @param[in] loc locator
1988 @param[in] loc_len locator length in bytes
1989 @param[in] task_id task identifier
1990 @param[in] in_err inform any error occurred
1991 @param[in] cbk callback interface
1992 @return error code */
1993 using Clone_ack_t = int (*)(handlerton *hton, THD *thd, const uchar *loc,
1994  uint loc_len, uint task_id, int in_err,
1995  Ha_clone_cbk *cbk);
1996 
1997 /** End copy from source database
1998 @param[in] hton handlerton for SE
1999 @param[in] thd server thread handle
2000 @param[in] loc locator
2001 @param[in] loc_len locator length in bytes
2002 @param[in] task_id task identifier
2003 @param[in] in_err error code when ending after error
2004 @return error code */
2005 using Clone_end_t = int (*)(handlerton *hton, THD *thd, const uchar *loc,
2006  uint loc_len, uint task_id, int in_err);
2007 
2008 /** Begin apply to destination database
2009 @param[in] hton handlerton for SE
2010 @param[in] thd server thread handle
2011 @param[in,out] loc locator
2012 @param[in,out] loc_len locator length
2013 @param[in] task_id task identifier
2014 @param[in] mode mode for starting clone
2015 @param[in] data_dir target data directory
2016 @return error code */
2017 using Clone_apply_begin_t = int (*)(handlerton *hton, THD *thd,
2018  const uchar *&loc, uint &loc_len,
2019  uint &task_id, Ha_clone_mode mode,
2020  const char *data_dir);
2021 
2022 /** Apply data to destination database in chunks via callback
2023 @param[in] hton handlerton for SE
2024 @param[in] thd server thread handle
2025 @param[in] loc locator
2026 @param[in] loc_len locator length in bytes
2027 @param[in] task_id task identifier
2028 @param[in] in_err inform any error occurred
2029 @param[in] cbk callback interface for receiving data
2030 @return error code */
2031 using Clone_apply_t = int (*)(handlerton *hton, THD *thd, const uchar *loc,
2032  uint loc_len, uint task_id, int in_err,
2033  Ha_clone_cbk *cbk);
2034 
2035 /** End apply to destination database
2036 @param[in] hton handlerton for SE
2037 @param[in] thd server thread handle
2038 @param[in] loc locator
2039 @param[in] loc_len locator length in bytes
2040 @param[in] task_id task identifier
2041 @param[in] in_err error code when ending after error
2042 @return error code */
2043 using Clone_apply_end_t = int (*)(handlerton *hton, THD *thd, const uchar *loc,
2044  uint loc_len, uint task_id, int in_err);
2045 
2046 struct Clone_interface_t {
2047  /* Get clone capabilities of an SE */
2048  Clone_capability_t clone_capability;
2049 
2050  /* Interfaces to copy data. */
2051  Clone_begin_t clone_begin;
2052  Clone_copy_t clone_copy;
2053  Clone_ack_t clone_ack;
2054  Clone_end_t clone_end;
2055 
2056  /* Interfaces to apply data. */
2057  Clone_apply_begin_t clone_apply_begin;
2058  Clone_apply_t clone_apply;
2059  Clone_apply_end_t clone_apply_end;
2060 };
2061 
2062 /**
2063  Perform post-commit/rollback cleanup after DDL statement (e.g. in
2064  case of DROP TABLES really remove table files from disk).
2065 
2066  @note This hook will be invoked after DDL commit or rollback only
2067  for storage engines supporting atomic DDL.
2068 
2069  @note Problems during execution of this method should be reported to
2070  error log and as warnings/notes to user. Since this method is
2071  called after successful commit of the statement we can't fail
2072  statement with error.
2073 */
2074 typedef void (*post_ddl_t)(THD *thd);
2075 
2076 /**
2077  Perform SE-specific cleanup after recovery of transactions.
2078 
2079  @note Particularly SEs supporting atomic DDL can use this call
2080  to perform post-DDL actions for DDL statements which were
2081  committed or rolled back during recovery stage.
2082 */
2083 typedef void (*post_recover_t)(void);
2084 
2085 /**
2086  Lock a handlerton (resource) log to collect log information.
2087 */
2088 
2089 typedef bool (*lock_hton_log_t)(handlerton *hton);
2090 
2091 /**
2092  Unlock a handlerton (resource) log after collecting log information.
2093 */
2094 
2095 typedef bool (*unlock_hton_log_t)(handlerton *hton);
2096 
2097 /**
2098  Collect a handlerton (resource) log information.
2099 */
2100 
2101 typedef bool (*collect_hton_log_info_t)(handlerton *hton, Json_dom *json);
2102 
2103 /**
2104  Check SE considers types of child and parent columns in foreign key
2105  to be compatible.
2106 
2107  @param child_column_type Child column type description.
2108  @param parent_column_type Parent column type description.
2109  @param check_charsets Indicates whether we need to check
2110  that charsets of string columns
2111  match. Which is true in most cases.
2112 
2113  @returns True if types are compatible, False if not.
2114 */
2115 
2116 typedef bool (*check_fk_column_compat_t)(
2117  const Ha_fk_column_type *child_column_type,
2118  const Ha_fk_column_type *parent_column_type, bool check_charsets);
2119 
2120 typedef bool (*is_reserved_db_name_t)(handlerton *hton, const char *name);
2121 
2122 /**
2123  Prepare the secondary engine for executing a statement. This function is
2124  called right after the secondary engine TABLE objects have been opened by
2125  open_secondary_engine_tables(), before the statement is optimized and
2126  executed. Secondary engines will typically create a context object in this
2127  function, which they can use to store state that is needed during the
2128  optimization and execution phases.
2129 
2130  @param thd thread context
2131  @param lex the statement to execute
2132  @return true on error, false on success
2133 */
2134 using prepare_secondary_engine_t = bool (*)(THD *thd, LEX *lex);
2135 
2136 /**
2137  Optimize a statement for execution on a secondary storage engine. This
2138  function is called when the optimization of a statement has completed, just
2139  before the statement is executed. Secondary engines can use this function to
2140  apply engine-specific optimizations to the execution plan. They can also
2141  reject executing the query by raising an error, in which case the query will
2142  be reprepared and executed by the primary storage engine.
2143 
2144  @param thd thread context
2145  @param lex the statement being optimized
2146  @return true on error, false on success
2147 */
2148 using optimize_secondary_engine_t = bool (*)(THD *thd, LEX *lex);
2149 
2150 /**
2151  Compares the cost of two join plans in the secondary storage engine. The cost
2152  of the current candidate is compared with the cost of the best plan seen so
2153  far.
2154 
2155  @param thd thread context
2156  @param join the candidate plan to evaluate
2157  @param optimizer_cost the cost estimate calculated by the optimizer
2158  @param[out] use_best_so_far true if the optimizer should stop searching for
2159  a better plan and use the best plan it has seen so far
2160  @param[out] cheaper true if the candidate is the best plan seen so far for
2161  this JOIN (must be true if it is the first plan seen),
2162  false otherwise
2163  @param[out] secondary_engine_cost the cost estimated by the secondary engine
2164 
2165  @return false on success, or true if an error has been raised
2166 */
2167 using compare_secondary_engine_cost_t = bool (*)(THD *thd, const JOIN &join,
2168  double optimizer_cost,
2169  bool *use_best_so_far,
2170  bool *cheaper,
2171  double *secondary_engine_cost);
2172 
2173 // FIXME: Temporary workaround to enable storage engine plugins to use the
2174 // before_commit hook. Remove after WL#11320 has been completed.
2175 typedef void (*se_before_commit_t)(void *arg);
2176 
2177 // FIXME: Temporary workaround to enable storage engine plugins to use the
2178 // after_commit hook. Remove after WL#11320 has been completed.
2179 typedef void (*se_after_commit_t)(void *arg);
2180 
2181 // FIXME: Temporary workaround to enable storage engine plugins to use the
2182 // before_rollback hook. Remove after WL#11320 has been completed.
2183 typedef void (*se_before_rollback_t)(void *arg);
2184 
2185 /*
2186  Page Tracking : interfaces to handlerton functions which starts/stops page
2187  tracking, and purges/fetches page tracking information.
2188 */
2189 
2190 /**
2191  Start page tracking.
2192 
2193  @param[out] start_id SE specific sequence number [LSN for InnoDB]
2194  indicating when the tracking was started
2195 
2196  @return Operation status.
2197  @retval 0 Success
2198  @retval other ER_* mysql error. Get error details from THD.
2199 */
2200 using page_track_start_t = int (*)(uint64_t *start_id);
2201 
2202 /**
2203  Stop page tracking.
2204 
2205  @param[out] stop_id SE specific sequence number [LSN for InnoDB]
2206  indicating when the tracking was stopped
2207 
2208  @return Operation status.
2209  @retval 0 Success
2210  @retval other ER_* mysql error. Get error details from THD.
2211 */
2212 using page_track_stop_t = int (*)(uint64_t *stop_id);
2213 
2214 /**
2215  Purge page tracking data.
2216 
2217  @param[in,out] purge_id SE specific sequence number [LSN for InnoDB]
2218  initially indicating till where the data needs to be purged and finally
2219  updated to until where it was actually purged
2220 
2221  @return Operation status.
2222  @retval 0 Success
2223  @retval other ER_* mysql error. Get error details from THD.
2224 */
2225 using page_track_purge_t = int (*)(uint64_t *purge_id);
2226 
2227 /**
2228  Fetch tracked pages.
2229 
2230  @param[in] cbk_func callback function return page IDs
2231  @param[in] cbk_ctx caller's context for callback
2232  @param[in,out] start_id SE specific sequence number [LSN for InnoDB] from
2233  where the pages tracked would be returned.
2234  @note The range might get expanded and the actual start_id used for the
2235  querying will be updated.
2236  @param[in,out] stop_id SE specific sequence number [LSN for InnoDB]
2237  until where the pages tracked would be returned.
2238  @note The range might get expanded and the actual stop_id used for the
2239  querying will be updated.
2240  @param[out] buffer allocated buffer to copy page IDs
2241  @param[in] buffer_len length of buffer in bytes
2242 
2243  @return Operation status.
2244  @retval 0 Success
2245  @retval other ER_* mysql error. Get error details from THD.
2246 */
2247 using page_track_get_page_ids_t = int (*)(Page_Track_Callback cbk_func,
2248  void *cbk_ctx, uint64_t *start_id,
2249  uint64_t *stop_id,
2250  unsigned char *buffer,
2251  size_t buffer_len);
2252 
2253 /**
2254  Fetch approximate number of tracked pages in the given range.
2255 
2256  @param[in,out] start_id SE specific sequence number [LSN for InnoDB] from
2257  where the pages tracked would be returned.
2258  @note the range might get expanded and the actual start_id used for the
2259  querying will be updated.
2260  @param[in,out] stop_id SE specific sequence number [LSN for InnoDB]
2261  until where the pages tracked would be returned.
2262  @note the range might get expanded and the actual stop_id used for the
2263  querying will be updated.
2264  @param[out] num_pages number of pages tracked
2265 
2266  @return Operation status.
2267  @retval 0 Success
2268  @retval other ER_* mysql error. Get error details from THD.
2269 */
2270 using page_track_get_num_page_ids_t = int (*)(uint64_t *start_id,
2271  uint64_t *stop_id,
2272  uint64_t *num_pages);
2273 
2274 /** Fetch the status of the page tracking system.
2275 @param[out] status vector of a pair of (ID, bool) where ID is the
2276 start/stop point and bool is true if the ID is a start point else false */
2277 using page_track_get_status_t =
2278  void (*)(std::vector<std::pair<uint64_t, bool>> &status);
2279 
2280 /** Page track interface */
2281 struct Page_track_t {
2282  page_track_start_t start;
2283  page_track_stop_t stop;
2284  page_track_purge_t purge;
2285  page_track_get_page_ids_t get_page_ids;
2286  page_track_get_num_page_ids_t get_num_page_ids;
2287  page_track_get_status_t get_status;
2288 };
2289 
2290 /**
2291  handlerton is a singleton structure - one instance per storage engine -
2292  to provide access to storage engine functionality that works on the
2293  "global" level (unlike handler class that works on a per-table basis).
2294 
2295  usually handlerton instance is defined statically in ha_xxx.cc as
2296 
2297  static handlerton { ... } xxx_hton;
2298 
2299  savepoint_*, prepare, recover, and *_by_xid pointers can be 0.
2300 */
2301 struct handlerton {
2302  /**
2303  Historical marker for if the engine is available or not.
2304  */
2305  SHOW_COMP_OPTION state;
2306 
2307  /**
2308  Historical number used for frm file to determine the correct storage engine.
2309  This is going away and new engines will just use "name" for this.
2310  */
2311  enum legacy_db_type db_type;
2312  /**
2313  Each storage engine has it's own memory area (actually a pointer)
2314  in the thd, for storing per-connection information.
2315  It is accessed as
2316 
2317  thd->ha_data[xxx_hton.slot]
2318 
2319  slot number is initialized by MySQL after xxx_init() is called.
2320  */
2321  uint slot;
2322  /**
2323  To store per-savepoint data storage engine is provided with an area
2324  of a requested size (0 is ok here).
2325  savepoint_offset must be initialized statically to the size of
2326  the needed memory to store per-savepoint information.
2327  After xxx_init it is changed to be an offset to savepoint storage
2328  area and need not be used by storage engine.
2329  see binlog_hton and binlog_savepoint_set/rollback for an example.
2330  */
2331  uint savepoint_offset;
2332 
2333  /* handlerton methods */
2334 
2335  close_connection_t close_connection;
2336  kill_connection_t kill_connection;
2337  pre_dd_shutdown_t pre_dd_shutdown;
2338  savepoint_set_t savepoint_set;
2339  savepoint_rollback_t savepoint_rollback;
2340  savepoint_rollback_can_release_mdl_t savepoint_rollback_can_release_mdl;
2341  savepoint_release_t savepoint_release;
2342  commit_t commit;
2343  rollback_t rollback;
2344  prepare_t prepare;
2345  recover_t recover;
2346  commit_by_xid_t commit_by_xid;
2347  rollback_by_xid_t rollback_by_xid;
2348  create_t create;
2349  drop_database_t drop_database;
2350  panic_t panic;
2351  start_consistent_snapshot_t start_consistent_snapshot;
2352  flush_logs_t flush_logs;
2353  show_status_t show_status;
2354  partition_flags_t partition_flags;
2355  is_valid_tablespace_name_t is_valid_tablespace_name;
2356  get_tablespace_t get_tablespace;
2357  alter_tablespace_t alter_tablespace;
2358  get_tablespace_filename_ext_t get_tablespace_filename_ext;
2359  upgrade_tablespace_t upgrade_tablespace;
2360  upgrade_space_version_t upgrade_space_version;
2361  get_tablespace_type_t get_tablespace_type;
2362  get_tablespace_type_by_name_t get_tablespace_type_by_name;
2363  upgrade_logs_t upgrade_logs;
2364  finish_upgrade_t finish_upgrade;
2365  fill_is_table_t fill_is_table;
2366  dict_init_t dict_init;
2367  ddse_dict_init_t ddse_dict_init;
2368  dict_register_dd_table_id_t dict_register_dd_table_id;
2369  dict_cache_reset_t dict_cache_reset;
2370  dict_cache_reset_tables_and_tablespaces_t
2371  dict_cache_reset_tables_and_tablespaces;
2372  dict_recover_t dict_recover;
2373  dict_get_server_version_t dict_get_server_version;
2374  dict_set_server_version_t dict_set_server_version;
2375  is_reserved_db_name_t is_reserved_db_name;
2376 
2377  /** Global handler flags. */
2378  uint32 flags;
2379 
2380  /*
2381  Those handlerton functions below are properly initialized at handler
2382  init.
2383  */
2384 
2385  binlog_func_t binlog_func;
2386  binlog_log_query_t binlog_log_query;
2387  acl_notify_t acl_notify;
2388  discover_t discover;
2389  find_files_t find_files;
2390  table_exists_in_engine_t table_exists_in_engine;
2391  is_supported_system_table_t is_supported_system_table;
2392 
2393  /*
