6664  If there is an open scan then this will be closed.
6665 
6666  This function should be called by handler::ha_reset() which is called
6667  when a statement is completed in order to make the handler object ready
6668  for re-use by a different statement.
6669  */
6670 
6671  void reset();
6672  int dsmrr_fill_buffer();
6673  int dsmrr_next(char **range_info);
6674 
6675  ha_rows dsmrr_info(uint keyno, uint n_ranges, uint keys, uint *bufsz,
6676  uint *flags, Cost_estimate *cost);
6677 
6678  ha_rows dsmrr_info_const(uint keyno, RANGE_SEQ_IF *seq, void *seq_init_param,
6679  uint n_ranges, uint *bufsz, uint *flags,
6680  Cost_estimate *cost);
6681 
6682  private:
6683  bool choose_mrr_impl(uint keyno, ha_rows rows, uint *flags, uint *bufsz,
6684  Cost_estimate *cost);
6685  bool get_disk_sweep_mrr_cost(uint keynr, ha_rows rows, uint flags,
6686  uint *buffer_size, Cost_estimate *cost);
6687 };
6688 
6689 /* lookups */
6690 handlerton *ha_default_handlerton(THD *thd);
6691 handlerton *ha_default_temp_handlerton(THD *thd);
6692 /**
6693  Resolve handlerton plugin by name, without checking for "DEFAULT" or
6694  HTON_NOT_USER_SELECTABLE.
6695 
6696  @param thd Thread context.
6697  @param name Plugin name.
6698 
6699  @return plugin or NULL if not found.
6700 */
6701 plugin_ref ha_resolve_by_name_raw(THD *thd, const LEX_CSTRING &name);
6702 plugin_ref ha_resolve_by_name(THD *thd, const LEX_CSTRING *name,
6703  bool is_temp_table);
6704 plugin_ref ha_lock_engine(THD *thd, const handlerton *hton);
6705 handlerton *ha_resolve_by_legacy_type(THD *thd, enum legacy_db_type db_type);
6706 handler *get_new_handler(TABLE_SHARE *share, bool partitioned, MEM_ROOT *alloc,
6707  handlerton *db_type);
6708 handlerton *ha_checktype(THD *thd, enum legacy_db_type database_type,
6709  bool no_substitute, bool report_error);
6710 
6711 /**
6712  Get default handlerton, if handler supplied is null.
6713 
6714  @param thd Thread context.
6715  @param hton The handlerton passed.
6716 
6717  @returns pointer to handlerton.
6718 */
6719 inline handlerton *get_default_handlerton(THD *thd, handlerton *hton) {
6720  if (!hton) {
6721  hton = ha_checktype(thd, DB_TYPE_UNKNOWN, false, false);
6722  DBUG_ASSERT(hton);
6723  }
6724  return hton;
6725 }
6726 
6727 static inline enum legacy_db_type ha_legacy_type(const handlerton *db_type) {
6728  return (db_type == nullptr) ? DB_TYPE_UNKNOWN : db_type->db_type;
6729 }
6730 
6731 const char *ha_resolve_storage_engine_name(const handlerton *db_type);
6732 
6733 static inline bool ha_check_storage_engine_flag(const handlerton *db_type,
6734  uint32 flag) {
6735  return db_type == nullptr ? false : (db_type->flags & flag);
6736 }
6737 
6738 /**
6739  Predicate to determine if a storage engine, represented by a handlerton*, is
6740  enabled.
6741  @note "Enabled" in this context refers only the state of the handlerton
6742  object, and does not consider the disabled_storage_engines system variable.
6743  This leads to the very counter-intuitive and confusing situation that it is
6744  possible for a storage engine to be enabled, but at the same time also be
6745  disabled.
6746  */
6747 inline bool ha_storage_engine_is_enabled(const handlerton *db_type) {
6748  return (db_type && db_type->create) ? (db_type->state == SHOW_OPTION_YES)
6749  : false;
6750 }

6757 int ha_finalize_handlerton(st_plugin_int *plugin);

6764 void ha_pre_dd_shutdown(void);

6770  commit during flush stage, false in other cases.
6771  @retval false Succeed
6772  @retval true Error
6773 */
6774 bool ha_flush_logs(bool binlog_group_flush = false);

6779  dd::Table *table_def);

6808 int ha_resize_key_cache(KEY_CACHE *key_cache);

6810 
6811 /* transactions: interface to handlerton functions */
6812 int ha_start_consistent_snapshot(THD *thd);
6813 int ha_commit_trans(THD *thd, bool all, bool ignore_global_read_lock = false);
6814 int ha_commit_attachable(THD *thd);
6815 int ha_rollback_trans(THD *thd, bool all);
6816 
6817 /* interface to handlerton function to prepare XA transaction */
6818 int ha_xa_prepare(THD *thd);
6819 
6820 /**
6821  recover() step of xa.
6822 
6823  @note
6824  there are three modes of operation:
6825  - automatic recover after a crash
6826  in this case commit_list != 0, tc_heuristic_recover==TC_HEURISTIC_NOT_USED
6827  all xids from commit_list are committed, others are rolled back
6828  - manual (heuristic) recover
6829  in this case commit_list==0, tc_heuristic_recover != TC_HEURISTIC_NOT_USED
6830  DBA has explicitly specified that all prepared transactions should
6831  be committed (or rolled back).
6832  - no recovery (MySQL did not detect a crash)
6833  in this case commit_list==0, tc_heuristic_recover == TC_HEURISTIC_NOT_USED
6834  there should be no prepared transactions in this case.
6835 */
6836 
6837 typedef ulonglong my_xid; // this line is the same as in log_event.h
6838 int ha_recover(const mem_root_unordered_set<my_xid> *commit_list);
6839 
6840 /**
6841  Perform SE-specific cleanup after recovery of transactions.
6842 
6843  @note SE supporting atomic DDL can use this method to perform
6844  post-DDL actions for DDL statements which were committed
6845  or rolled back during recovery stage.
6846 */
6847 void ha_post_recover();
6848 
6849 /*
6850  transactions: interface to low-level handlerton functions. These are
6851  intended to be used by the transaction coordinators to
6852  commit/prepare/rollback transactions in the engines.
6853 */
6854 int ha_commit_low(THD *thd, bool all, bool run_after_commit = true);
6855 int ha_prepare_low(THD *thd, bool all);

6913 
6914 /*
6915  This class is used by INFORMATION_SCHEMA.FILES to read SE specific
6916  tablespace dynamic metadata. Some member like m_type and id, is not
6917  really dynamic, but as this information is not stored in data dictionary
6918  in a generic format and still is SE specific Some member like m_type and
6919  id, is not really dynamic, but as this information is not stored in data
6920  dictionary in a generic format and still needs SE specific decision, we
6921  are requesting the same from SE.
6922 */
6923 
6924 class ha_tablespace_statistics {
6925  public:
6926  ha_tablespace_statistics()
6927  : m_id(0),
6928  m_logfile_group_number(-1),
6929  m_free_extents(0),
6930  m_total_extents(0),
6931  m_extent_size(0),
6932  m_initial_size(0),
6933  m_maximum_size(0),
6934  m_autoextend_size(0),
6935  m_version(-1),
6936  m_data_free(0) {}
6937 
6938  ulonglong m_id;
6939  dd::String_type m_type;
6940  dd::String_type m_logfile_group_name; // NDB only
6941  ulonglong m_logfile_group_number; // NDB only
6942  ulonglong m_free_extents;
6943  ulonglong m_total_extents;
6944  ulonglong m_extent_size;
6945  ulonglong m_initial_size;
6946  ulonglong m_maximum_size;
6947  ulonglong m_autoextend_size;
6948  ulonglong m_version; // NDB only
6949  dd::String_type m_row_format; // NDB only
6950  ulonglong m_data_free; // InnoDB
6951  dd::String_type m_status;
6952  dd::String_type m_extra; // NDB only
6953 };
6954 
6955 #endif /* HANDLER_INCLUDED */
